caption:
This photograph captures a group of students standing beside a yellow school bus, labeled "New Ulm Schools," suggesting they are likely part of a school outing or field trip. The setting is a rural area, with visible farmland extending into the distance beyond the group, primarily under a clear sky with a few clouds.

There is a range of students of varying ages, dressed in casual clothing that includes jeans, jackets, and hats, suggesting a relaxed and informal occasion. Some students are looking directly towards the camera with smiles, while others are interacting with each other. The mood is cheerful and lively, suggested by their body language and expressions. The open bus door and the students beside and around the bus add a dynamic element to the scene, indicating movement or the process of disembarking or boarding the bus. The natural lighting from the sun enhances the outdoor, daytime setting of the photo.
title: Teenagers leaving their transportation are about to begin their summer day detasseling corn in fields near New Ulm Minnesota.  The hybrid corn seed for the following year is obtained in this manner.  It is one way for young people to make money from the seed corn companies.  The youths earn their pay.  It can be cold wet work early in the morning when the tall corn plants are covered with heavy dew.  Then it can get hot and muggy as the sun climbs overhead
